intro: Rumia microcarpos, commonly known as the small-fruited rumia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, typical of the Malvaceae family. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in plant morphology and ecology.
